message.content:
cs.DB, cs.DS, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

This paper is primarily focused on improving the performance of relational database management systems (RDBMSs) through the use of secondary indexing mechanisms. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.DB (Databases). The paper also proposes a new data structure called the Tiered Regression Search Tree (TRS-Tree), which is used to capture column correlations and outliers. This suggests that the paper could also be classified under cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of machine learning techniques to enhance the performance of the indexing mechanism, which could place it under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper also discusses the impact of the indexing mechanism on query response time and index maintenance time, which could place it under cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
